block.p: Jenelle June DeCoteau, a daughter of Patricia and Collis A. DeCoteau of Miami, was married yesterday to Howard Gregory Baker, the son of Carolyn Saunders Baker and Howard L. Baker of Tinton Falls, N.J. The Rev. Norbert M. Cooper, an Episcopal priest, officiated at the Palms South Beach hotel in Miami Beach.
Ms. DeCoteau, 27, is keeping her name. She is an associate at Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom, the New York law firm. She graduated from Columbia and received her law degree from Harvard.
The couple were married on Saturday at the Palms South Beach hotel in Miami Beach.

Jenelle June DeCoteau, a daughter of Patricia and Collis A. DeCoteau of Miami, was married yesterday to Howard Gregory Baker, the son of Carolyn Saunders Baker and Howard L. Baker of Tinton Falls, N.J. The Rev. Norbert M. Cooper, an Episcopal priest, officiated at the Palms South Beach hotel in Miami Beach.
Ms. DeCoteau, 27, is keeping her name. She is an associate at Skadden, Arps, Slate, Meagher & Flom, the New York law firm. She graduated from Columbia and received her law degree from Harvard.
Her father retired as a sales representative in Miami for NorVergence, a telephone services provider. Her mother is an emergency room nurse at Jackson South Community Hospital in Palmetto Bay, Fla.
Mr. Baker, 28, is an associate in the New York office of Quinn Emanuel Urquhart Oliver & Hedges, a Los Angeles law firm. He graduated from Amherst and received his law degree from Columbia.
His mother is a social worker at Monmouth Regional High School in Tinton Falls. His father is a consultant in Tinton Falls who provides advice on recruiting executives and other staff.
